EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.93}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to HR Tech and Culture or the cell corresponding to Diversity & Inclusion and Wellbeing?
Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Performance and Skills Gap or the cell corresponding to Retention and Turnover?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Retention} and {Turnover} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Compliance and Skills Gap or the cell corresponding to HR Tech and Skills Gap?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {HR Tech} and {Skills Gap} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Compliance and Productivity or the cell corresponding to Compliance and Wellbeing?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Compliance} and {Productivity} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.29 to 0.54?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Compliance, Culture), (Performance, Culture), (Diversity & Inclusion, Engagement), (HR Tech, Engagement), (Benefits, Leadership), (Training, Leadership), (Compensation, Productivity), (Retention, Productivity), (Compensation, Skills Gap), (Retention, Skills Gap), (Benefits, Training Hours), (Training, Training Hours), (Diversity & Inclusion, Turnover), (HR Tech, Turnover), (Compliance, Wellbeing), (Performance, Wellbeing)}.
